Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..name: key
Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..abstract: This is a String key that uniquely identifies this screen. It must be unique for the Array.

Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..abstract: This forces the UI elements to be updated.

Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..name: peripheralInstance
Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..abstract: If the screen is associated with a Peripheral, that Peripheral is exposed here. It can be nil.

Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..name: MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol
Protocols/MacOS_ControllerList_Protocol..abstract: This protocol defines the requirements for any View Controller that will be listed by the App Delegate.

Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC13.name: appVersionString
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC13.abstract: The app version, as a string. It is required, and “ERROR” is returned if it is not present.

Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC13.name: appVersionBuildString
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC13.abstract: The build version, as a string. It is required, and “ERROR” is returned if it is not present.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.name: addScreen(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.abstract: Adds a screen to our Array. If it is already there, nothing happens.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.name: removeScreen(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.abstract: Removes the given screen from our Array.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa13Blue_Van_Cl.abstract: This subscript allows us to fetch an instance by its String key.

Extensions/Bundle.html.name: Bundle
Extensions/Bundle.html.abstract: This extension adds a few simple accessors for some of the more common bundle items.

Classes/MacOS_Base_WindowController.html.name: windowDidLoad()
Classes/MacOS_Base_WindowController.html.abstract: This accounts for a bug in Xcode, where the restorable flag is ignored. If you set the name here, it will restore.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: storyboardID

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: minimumThickness

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _selectedCharacteristic
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: If a Characteristic was selected in the table, this is a semaphore for that.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _tableMap
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This will map the discovered Services and Characteristics for display in the table. The key is the ID of the Service. The value is all the rows (Characteristic IDs) it will display.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: peripheralInstance
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This is the Peripheral instance associated with this screen.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: serviceTableContainerView

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: serviceTableView
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This is the Services tableView.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: loadingSpinner

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: disconnectThisPeripheral(_:)
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called when the disconnect button is hit, or we want to disconnect the device.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _completeTableMapRowCount
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This is a complete count of all advertisement data rows, and headers.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _sortedServices
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This just helps us to keep the table in a predictable order.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _buildTableMap()

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: _getIndexedTableMapRow(_:)
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This returns the row string, along with whether or not it is a header, for the indexed row.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This shows and starts the loading spinner.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: stopLoadingAnimation()
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This stops and hides the loading spinner.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called when the view hierachy has loaded.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: viewWillAppear()
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called just before the screen appears.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: viewWillDisappear()
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called just before the screen disappears.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called to indicate whether or not the row is a group header.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This is called when a row is selected. We match the device to the row, set that in the semaphore, and approve the selection.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: Called after the selection was set up and approved.

Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.name: infoPadding

Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.abstract: This is the “Start Over From Scratch” button.

Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.abstract: Called when the Connect/Disconnect button is hit.

Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.abstract: This forces the UI elements to be updated.

Classes/MacOS_CharacteristicViewControll.name: _crlf

Classes/MacOS_CharacteristicViewControll.name: writeTextFieldLabelContainer

Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This is an accessor to our shared prefs object.

Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html#/.name: centralManager
Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This is the Bluetooth Central Manager instance. Everything goes through this.

Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html#/.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This displays a simple alert, with an OK button.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: deviceScreenID

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: timeoutInSeconds
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is the length of our timeout, in seconds.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.name: appNameMenuTitle
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.abstract: This is the menu item for the main app menu. It allows us to customize the text.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.name: aboutMenuItem
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.abstract: This is the menu item for the about item. It allows us to customize the text.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.name: quitMenuItem
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.abstract: This is the menu item for the quit item. It allows us to customize the text.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is the Bluetooth Central Manager instance. Everything goes through this.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.name: mainSreenOpen
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Blu.abstract: This is true, if the main window is open.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@CM@Bl.name: applicationDidFinishLaunching(_:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@CM@Bl.abstract: Called when the app has completed launching.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@CM@Bl.name: appDelegateObject
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/c:@CM@Bl.abstract: This is a quick way to get this object instance (it’s a SINGLETON), cast as the correct class.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This displays a simple alert, with an OK button.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: collapseSplit()

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: updateFrom(_:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance to do whatever it needs to do to update its data.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager(_:didConnectThisDevice:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that a Peripheral device has been connected.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager(_:willDisconnectThisDevice:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: Called prior to a device being disconnected.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager(_:deviceInfoChanged:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that a Peripheral device has had some change.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManagerPoweredOn(_:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that the state of the Central manager just became “powered on.”

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager(_:device:service:changedCharacteristicNotificationState:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that a Characteristic changed its notification state.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called when a Peripheral announces a change to one of its Characteristics.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that a Characteristic write with response received its response.

Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.name: centralManager(_:device:service:characteristic:changedDescriptor:)
Classes/MacOS_AppDelegate.html#/s:13Blue.abstract: This is called to tell the instance that a Descriptor changed its value.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: continuouslyUpdatePeripherals
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a Boolean value. If true, then the scan will not use duplicate filtering (meaning that it will be continuously updating).

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: peripheralFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Peripherals for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: serviceFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Services for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: characteristicFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Characteristics for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: minimumRSSILevel
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a signed Integer, with the minimum RSSI.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: discoverOnlyConnectableDevices
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a Bool, true, if we are filtering out non-connectable devices.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: allowEmptyNames
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a Bool, true, if we are allowing devices that don’t have names to be discovered.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: alwaysUseCRLF
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a Bool, true, if we will always force endline/carriage returns to be CRLF pairs.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: tableSelectionBackgroundColor
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This will be a CGColor, indicating the color to use for the selected table cells.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: textColorForUnselectableCells
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: This is a floating-point number to be used as an alpha component.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.name: allKeys
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html#/s.abstract: These are all the keys, in an Array of String.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html.name: Keys
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs/Keys.html.abstract: This is an enumeration that will list the prefs keys for us.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:13Bl.name: keys
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:13Bl.abstract: This is a list of the keys for our prefs.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: continuouslyUpdatePeripherals
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a Boolean value. If true, then the scan will not use duplicate filtering (meaning that it will be continuously updating).

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: discoverOnlyConnectableDevices
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a Boolean value. If true, then devices that are not advertising as connctable will be ignored.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: allowEmptyNames
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a Boolean value. If true, then devices that do not have names will be included. Default is false.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: alwaysUseCRLF
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a Boolean value. If true, then we will always send newlines as CRLF pairs. Default is false.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: minimumRSSILevel
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a Boolean value. If true, then the scan will not use duplicate filtering (meaning that it will be continuously updating).

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: peripheralFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Peripherals for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: serviceFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Services for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: characteristicFilterIDArray
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is an Array of String, containing the UUIDs of specific Characteristics for which we are filtering.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: tableSelectionBackgroundColor
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a CGColor, indicating the color to use for the selected table cells.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.name: textColorForUnselectableCells
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is a floating-point number to be used as an alpha component. We use it for the table cells that can’t be clicked.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:13Bl.name: scanCriteria
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:13Bl.abstract: This is the scan criteria object to be used for filtering scans.

Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html.name: CGA_PersistentPrefs
Classes/CGA_PersistentPrefs.html.abstract: This is the subclass of the preferences type that will provide our persistent app settings.

Classes/MacOS_TransparentScroller.html.name: MacOS_TransparentScroller
Classes/MacOS_TransparentScroller.html.abstract: This overrides the draw(_:) method, to ensure that only the “knob” gets drawn.

Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html.name: MacOS_Base_ViewController
Classes/MacOS_Base_ViewController.html.abstract: This class provides some common tools for all view controllers.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth_MacOS_Test_Harness.name: RVS_BlueThoth_MacOS_Test_Harness_Base_SplitView_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth_MacOS_Test_Harness.abstract: This is for views designed to be displayed in the split view.

Classes/MacOS_SplitViewController.html.name: MacOS_SplitViewController
Classes/MacOS_SplitViewController.html.abstract: This is the first screen to come up, and contains all the other screens.

Classes/MacOS_PreferencesViewController..name: MacOS_PreferencesViewController
Classes/MacOS_PreferencesViewController..abstract: This is the Preferences/Settings modal screen.

Classes/MacOS_CharacteristicViewControll.name: MacOS_CharacteristicViewController
Classes/MacOS_CharacteristicViewControll.abstract: This controls the screen for a selected Characteristic. It appears in the screen just to the right of the Peripheral Screen.

Classes/MacOS_Clicker.html.name: MacOS_Clicker
Classes/MacOS_Clicker.html.abstract: This is a subclass of the standard button class, allowing us to attach a device discovery record.

Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.name: MacOS_DiscoveryViewController
Classes/MacOS_DiscoveryViewController.ht.abstract: This is the permanent Device Discovery Screen. It is the leftmost screen, and contains a table that is updated as the discovery scanning goes on.

Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.name: MacOS_PeripheralViewController
Classes/MacOS_PeripheralViewController.h.abstract: This controls the main screen for a Peripheral, once it has been selected in the Discovery screen. It appears in the first screen to the right of the Discovery Screen.

Classes/MacOS_Base_WindowController.html.name: MacOS_Base_WindowController
Classes/MacOS_Base_WindowController.html.abstract: The main reason for creating this class was to allow us to interpret settings, and to fix an issue with Interface Builder.
